events.message: Customer reported a car collision that occurred on a busy street, resulting in significant damage to the vehicleâ€™s front bumper and headlights.
Claim has been correctly categorized under Auto Accident based on the keywords found in the initial report regarding a car collision.
A claims agent specialized in auto insurance was assigned to the case to ensure proper handling and follow-up.
The customer was contacted and the claim was acknowledged, confirming receipt and next steps for the investigation process.
Requested photographs of the vehicle damage, police report, and any eyewitness statements to support the claim assessment.
Customer submitted all requested documents including photos of the damaged car and a copy of the police collision report.
Investigation team began examining the submitted evidence to verify the cause of the accident and assess liability factors.
Investigation concluded confirming the customer was not at fault, and damage assessment was consistent with collision details reported.
A settlement amount covering vehicle repairs and associated costs was proposed to the customer for review and approval.
Customer responded with positive feedback, expressing satisfaction with the proposed settlement offer and claim handling.
The claim was formally approved by the underwriting team following confirmation of all investigation results and documentation.
Payment covering the repair costs of the damaged vehicle was issued to the customer promptly after claim approval.
The claim file was closed successfully as all requirements were met and the customer received full compensation.
All claim records and documentation were archived securely for future reference and regulatory compliance.
